intro: Campylocentrum lansbergii, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers bloom during the winter season, giving the plant its common name.
